Strengthening Institutional Capacity for Project Development and Urban Governance in Tamil Nadu 
(TRTA IND 49107-003) 
OUTLINE TERMS OF REFERENCE FOR CONSULTANTS 
 
A.  Outline Terms of References 
 
1.  Urban infrastructure specialist (international, 2 person-months). The specialist will 
be an engineer (civil or environmental engineer, or other relevant discipline) and will have at least 
10 years of experience in providing design, project management and organizational development 
support to government agencies implementing urban infrastructure projects. The specialist will be 
responsible  for  developing  an  organizational  development  plan  for  the  project  design  and 
management cell (PDMC) and identifying key work processes that PDMC should follow. The 
specialist will also identify, in consultation with Commissionerate of Municipal Administration 
(CMA), the technical standards and manuals relevant for PDMC and urban local bodies (ULBs) 
for the first 5–10 years of its functioning. The specialist will also train PDMC and ULB staff in 
urban infrastructure project design and management.  
 
2.  Organizational process specialist (international, 2 person-months). The specialist 
will be an engineer (civil or environmental engineer, or other relevant discipline). The specialist 
will have at least 5 years of experience in organizational development and capacity building of 
project implementation agencies in urban infrastructure. The specialist will have experience in 
designing work processes and information technology systems for use by project implementation 
agencies. The specialist will be responsible for developing detailed work processes for PDMC 
and for scoping the information technology systems that PDMC should use. The specialist will 
also  train  PDMC  staff  in  work  flow  processes  and  information  technology  tools  for  urban 
infrastructure design and project management.  
 
3.  Energy efficiency specialist (international, 1 person-month). The specialist will be a 
civil or electrical engineer with at least 10 years of experience in developing energy efficiency 
solutions in the urban sector. The specialist will provide advice regarding and design technical 
standards and manuals for energy efficiency and renewable energy projects in the urban sector, 
including solar-powered utility solutions. The specialist will also train PDMC and ULB staff in 
identifying energy efficiency and renewable energy opportunities, embedding energy efficiency 
principles in new project design, and in operation and maintenance. 
 
4.  Urban resilience and climate change specialist (international, 1 person-month). The 
specialist will be an environmental engineer with at least 10 years of experience in design of urban 
infrastructure investment and at least 5 years of experience in climate change and urban 
resilience projects. The specialist will be responsible for developing technical standards and 
manuals for incorporating climate change and urban resilience principles in the work processes 
of PDMC and ULBs. The specialist will also train PDMC and ULB staff in climate change and 
urban resilience.  
 
5.  Urban institutional and governance specialist (international, 1 person-month). The 
specialist will be an urban planner, civil or environmental engineer, accountant or business 
management graduate with at least 10 years of experience in institutional development in the 
urban infrastructure sector. The specialist will prepare the operating manual for PDMC. The 
specialist will train PDMC and ULB staff in urban institutional development and capacity building 
measures to be planned concurrent with urban investments. The specialist will also review the 
performance of ULBs in Tamil Nadu, and prepare an agenda for institutional development and 
governance improvement under the governance improvement component.

2   
6.  Urban infrastructure specialist (national, 8 person-months). The specialist will be a 
civil or environmental engineer with at least 10 years of experience in design and management 
of  urban  infrastructure  projects.  The  specialist  will  also  have  experience  in  organizational 
development of project management agencies in the urban sector. The specialist will lead the 
team of consultants, design a medium-term organizational development plan for PDMC, and train 
PDMC and ULB staff.  
 
7.  Civil engineer (national, 4 person-months). The expert will be a civil engineer with at 
least 10 years of experience in design and implementation of urban roads and civil construction 
in the urban sector. The expert will develop technical standards and manuals for PDMC and will 
train PDMC staff. 
 
8.  Environmental engineer (national, 4 person-months). The expert will be a civil or 
environmental engineer with at least 10 years of experience in design and implementation of 
water supply, sewage, drainage and sanitation projects in urban areas. The expert will develop 
technical standards and manuals and will train PDMC and ULB staff.  
 
9.  Urban institutional and governance specialist (national, 4 person-months). The 
specialist will be an urban planner, civil or environmental engineer, accountant or business 
management graduate with at least 10 years of experience in institutional development in the 
urban infrastructure sector. The specialist will review the implementation of the governance 
improvement cell and support CMA in preparing policy recommendations for the government of 
Tamil Nadu and in the design of tranche 2. The specialist will also train PDMC and ULB staff in 
urban  institutional  development  and  urban  financial  improvement  measures  required  to  be 
planned concurrent with urban investments. The specialist will also conduct quarterly reviews of 
the implementation of standard work processes in design and project management activities of 
PDMC.  
 
10.  Urban transport specialist (national, 2 person-months). The specialist will be an urban 
planner  or  urban  transport  planner  with  at  least  10  years  of  experience  in  design  and 
implementation of urban transport and non-motorized solutions for urban areas. The expert will 
develop technical standards and manuals for PDMC and will train PDMC and ULB staff.  
 
11.  Information technology & e-governance specialist (national, 4 person-months). The 
specialist will be a graduate in computer science and will have at least 10 years of experience in 
developing information technology, e-governance, and automation or smart solutions for urban 
infrastructure. The specialist will develop technical standards and manuals for PDMC, and review 
the information technology-based work processes required for PDMC and implementation of 
information technology systems.
